Load example phylospatial data on California mosses

moss_data.Rd

This function returns the moss phylospatial data set, with options for raster vs polygon formatting and for probability vs binary community data type.

Usage

moss_data(
  data_type = c("probability", "binary"),
  spatial_type = c("raster", "polygons")
)

Arguments

data_type

Either "probability" or "binary".

spatial_type

Either "raster" or "polygons".

Value

A phylospatial object with a phylogeny and modeled distributions of 443 species of mosses, representing a spatially coarser version of data published by Kling et al. (2024).

References

Kling, Gonzalez-Ramirez, et al. (2024) bioRxiv, https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.12.16.628580.

Examples

moss_data("prob", "poly")
#> `phylospatial` object
#>   - 884 lineages across 171 sites
#>   - community data type: probability 
#>   - spatial data class: sf 
#>   - dissimilarity data: none 

# \donttest{
moss_data("bin", "rast")
#> `phylospatial` object
#>   - 884 lineages across 288 sites
#>   - community data type: binary 
#>   - spatial data class: SpatRaster 
#>   - dissimilarity data: none 
# }
